modName: Making Armor and Body Replacers work for Enderal
summary: fitting cbbe, unp and uunp to Enderal
descriptionHtml:
This is possibly not flawless and I've not played the full game of Enderal yet but so far it is working and so i am sharing this here for people to try if they wish.

So you have installed your body replacer and armor as you normally would but either your character of some of the npc's are nude or statues.There is a minor glitch with two of the races in Enderal that needs to be addressed in your armor replacers .esp.

Install "TES5Edit"
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?

Install"Automation Tools for TES5Edit"
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49373/?

also remember to installÂ "FNIS Patch for Enderal"
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/76979/?

If you have installed these Mods, then start TES5Edit, deselect all Mods and select Remodeled Armor - Vanilla Replacer.esp
1: Click on Remodeled Armor - Vanilla Replacer.esp
2: Click on ArmorAddon and select all
3: Right click and select Apply Script
4: Select - Script AT - Quickchange
5: As function chose ElementAssign
6: In the Field Path write MODL
7: In the Field Value write [RACE:00033899] and click ok
8: Repeat Step 1 to 6, but now write in the Field Value [RACE:00033898] and Click Ok
Close TES5Edit

(If you use Mod Organizer double click on Overwrite and delete all files)

Run FNIS and tick the first two checkboxes and run
Close FNIS.

(If you use Mod Organizer right click on Overwrite, click on create a new mod and call it Enderal FNIS. Activate it.
Ensure Enderal FNIS is the last mod in your Loadorder)

Open Bodyslide and Outfit Studio and run as normal

And that is it, play Enderal.
author: Chainskleft
